content.text: The villagers cheer as you enter the battlefield‚Ä¶ until ‚Äî SPLAT! üü¢üëæ A slime monster named *Jellothor* jiggles out of the bushes. It smells like expired pudding.
The Math Wizard Menthus yells: ‚ÄúQuick! Use your numbers before it multiplies!‚Äù
Welcome, hero, to *Battle Math* ‚Äî where every swing, heal, and loot split depends on operators.
Arithmetic Operators
Operators are your battle skills! Each one has a secret power:
üí° Think of them as your hero‚Äôs four basic moves!
Hero Training Drill 1 ‚Äì First Punch üëä
The slime punches! You must calculate your remaining HP before fainting.

content.expected_output: The monster punches you! HP left: 75
content.solution:
hero_hp = 100 
hero_hp = hero_hp - 25 
print("The monster punches you! HP left:", hero_hp)

content.text: Normal division (/) gives decimals, but heroes only deal in *whole coins*. üßù‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è The Loot Goblin Glimmer says: ‚ÄúWe share coins‚Ä¶ but I keep the leftovers!‚Äù
coins = 50 players = 3 print(coins // players)  # 16 coins each
üí° Floor division // means 'only the whole coins, no decimals allowed!'
Hero Training Drill 2 ‚Äì Goblin Loot üí∞
You defeat a goblin carrying 25 coins. Divide the loot between 4 heroes with "//" and print how many each gets.

content.solution:
coins = 25 
players = 4 
print("Each hero gets", coins // players, "coins.")

content.text: The % operator is for leftovers! Perfect for counting spare loot or broken swords. üê± Healer Cat Meowlin: ‚ÄúOne extra coin? I‚Äôll just use it to buy milk.‚Äù
coins = 25 players = 4 print(coins % players)   # 1 coin left
Hero Training Drill 3 ‚Äì The Lonely Coin ü™ô
You defeat a goblin carrying 25 coins. Find out how many coins remain after the goblin loot is split between 4 players.

content.solution:
coins = 25 
players = 4 
print("Lonely leftover coin:", coins % players)

content.text: The ** operator is your *Power-Up Spell*! It‚Äôs like casting ‚ÄòCRITICAL HIT MODE!‚Äô ‚ö° The Math Wizard Menthus waves his staff: ‚ÄúRaise it to the power of doom!‚Äù
# Output: Critical hit damage: 49
Hero Training Drill 4 ‚Äì Mega Fireball üî•
Your wizard sneezes out a fireball. Base damage = 5. Critical fireball damage = base ** 3.

content.solution:
attack = 5 
critical = attack ** 3 
print("The wizard sneezes... FIREBALL! Damage:", critical)

content.text: When battles get chaotic, your hero performs multiple moves at once. Python follows *PEMDAS* ‚Äî Parentheses, Exponent, Multiply/Divide, Add/Subtract.
damage = 10 + 5 * 2 print(damage)  # 20, not 30
üí° Without parentheses, your hero might heal first‚Ä¶ then faint anyway.
Hero Training Drill 5 ‚Äì Goblin Claw Combo ü©∏
The goblin claws for (5 + 3) * 2 damage. Calculate total damage.

content.solution:
damage = (5 + 3) * 2 
print("Goblin claws you for", damage, "damage!")

lessons.subject: python
lessons.title: Challenge Quest - The Epic Slime Battle

items: You face the mighty Slime King Jellothor.
Treasure chest = 47 coins shared among 3 allies

content.text: Your mission: perform full battle math to survive and count your loot.

content.starter_code:
# Write your Python code here


# Normal attack


# Critical Hits


# Heal


# Loot
content.expected_output:
The Slime King squishes you! HP left: 82 
CRITICAL SLIME SPLASH! HP left: -242 
The healer gives you soup. HP left: -232 
Each hero gets 11 coins. 
Leftover coins: 3
content.solution:
hero_hp = 100 
monster_attack = 18 
 
# Normal attack 
hero_hp -= monster_attack 
print("The Slime King squishes you! HP left:", hero_hp) 
 
# Critical hit 
critical = monster_attack ** 2 
hero_hp -= critical 
print("CRITICAL SLIME SPLASH! HP left:", hero_hp) 
 
# Heal 
hero_hp += 10 
print("The healer gives you soup. HP left:", hero_hp) 
 
# Loot 
coins = 47 
allies = 4 
print("Each hero gets", coins // allies, "coins.") 
print("Leftover coins:", coins % allies)

content.text: So far, heroes master all Python operators ‚Äî +, -, *, /, //, %, and **. They understand operator precedence with parentheses. Battle math becomes second nature!
Their hero has (barely) survived the Slime King‚Äôs wrath ‚Äî stronger, smarter, and a little slimier.
üëâ Next week: Survive multiple rounds of battle using loops!
üßô‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è The Math Wizard Menthus says: ‚ÄúEvery hero must master the four sacred moves of math!‚Äù

items: Arithmetic operators control your hero‚Äôs power in battles:

content.text: üßæ Examples

hero_hp = 90 
hero_hp = hero_hp + 10 
print("You drink a potion! HP:", hero_hp) 
 
damage = 20 
hero_hp = hero_hp - damage 
print("A bat bites! HP left:", hero_hp) 

Output: 
You drink a potion! HP: 100 
A bat bites! HP left: 80
üéØ Practice Drills for Arithmetic Operators

items: Task: Start with hero_hp = 60. Heal by 25. Print new HP.

content.solution:
hero_hp = 60 
hero_hp += 25 
print('HP after potion:', hero_hp)

items: Task: Start with hero_hp = 90. Take 35 damage. Print remaining HP.

content.solution:
hero_hp = 90 
hero_hp -= 35 
print('Remaining HP:', hero_hp)

items: Task: You have 60 coins and 3 allies. Use / to show equal split.

content.solution:
coins = 60 
allies = 3 
print('Each ally gets', coins / allies, 'coins')

items: Each slimelet deals 5 damage. There are 4 of them.
Your HP = 120. Calculate final HP after battle.

content.starter_code:
# Write your Python code here
print("Hello, World!")
content.solution:
hero_hp = 120 
slime_damage = 5 * 4 
hero_hp -= slime_damage 
print('HP after swarm:', hero_hp)

content.text: Section: Remedial Python Floor Division
ü™ô The Goblin Glimmer snickers: ‚ÄúHeroes never share loot evenly, but I do love counting!‚Äù
üí° Concept Review: // divides numbers and returns only the whole part of the result (no decimals).
üßæ Examples

coins = 53 
heroes = 4 
print(coins // heroes)   # Each gets 13 coins
üéØ Practice Drills for Floor Division

items: Task: 25 coins shared by 4 heroes. Print how many coins each hero gets (whole number).

content.solution:
coins = 25 
heroes = 4 
print('Each hero gets', coins // heroes, 'coins')

content.text:
Drill F2 ‚Äì The Greedy Goblin üßå 
- Task: 37 gems split among 5 goblins. Use // to see how many each gets.

content.solution:
gems = 37 
goblins = 5 
print('Each goblin grabs', gems // goblins, 'gems')

content.text:
Drill F3 ‚Äì Loot Festival üéâ 
- Task: You win 99 gold pieces and have 8 allies. Calculate gold per ally.

content.expected_output: Output: Each ally gets 12 gold coins
content.solution:
gold = 99 
allies = 8 
print('Each ally gets', gold // allies, 'gold coins')

content.text: Section: Remedial Python Modulus
üêæ The Healer Cat Meowlin meows: ‚ÄúThe % operator finds leftovers ‚Äî just like leftover soup!‚Äù
üí° Concept Review: % gives the remainder after division. Useful for leftover coins or items.
üßæ Examples

coins = 25 
players = 4 
print("Leftover coins:", coins % players) # 1 leftover coin

items: Task: 37 coins split among 6 players. Find leftover coins.

content.solution:
coins = 37 
players = 6 
print('Leftover coins:', coins % players

items: Task: 50 potions stored 9 per shelf. How many remain?

content.solution:
potions = 50 
shelf = 9 
print('Potions remaining:', potions % shelf

items: Task: 47 socks packed 8 per bag. How many socks remain?

content.solution:
socks = 47 
bag = 8 
print('Socks left:', socks % bag)

content.text: Section: Remedial Python Exponent
üßô‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è The Math Wizard Menthus chants: ‚ÄúRaise your numbers to the power of glory!‚Äù
üí° Concept Review: ** raises one number to the power of another.
üßæ Examples

attack = 6 
power = attack ** 2 
print("Critical hit damage:", power) # 35 critical hit damage
üéØ Practice Drills for Exponent

content.starter_code:
# Write your Python code here
print("Hello, World!")
content.solution:
attack = 3 
print('Attack power:', attack ** 2)

content.starter_code:
# Write your Python code here
print("Hello, World!")
content.solution:
base = 4 
print('Mega blast damage:', base ** 3)

items: Task: hero = 2, villain = 5. Compute villain ** hero.

content.starter_code:
# Write your Python code here
print("Hello, World!")
content.solution:
hero = 2 
villain = 5 
print('Villain‚Äôs spell power:', villain ** hero)

content.text: Section: Remedial Python Precedence

items: Order of operations matters! Python follows PEMDAS.
Parentheses first, then Exponents, Multiplication/Division, and finally Addition/Subtraction.

content.text: üßæ Examples

damage = 10 + 5 * 2 
print(damage)   # 20 

damage = (10 + 5) * 2 
print(damage)   # 30
üéØ Practice Drills for Precedence

content.starter_code:
# Write your Python code here
print("Hello, World!")

# Write your Python code here
print("Hello, World!")

items: Task: A formula (5 + 2) ** 2 / 3. Compute its value.

content.starter_code:
# Write your Python code here
print("Hello, World!")

content.text: Section: Remedial Python Review All

üßô‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è The Math Wizard Duel ‚Äì Final Challenge ‚öîÔ∏è The wizard Meowlin challenges you to a duel of numbers! You must use everything you‚Äôve learned to calculate the result of multiple operations.
üéØ Practice: Hero vs. Math Wizard Duel

items: Step 4: Casts Power Spell (base = 3, power = base ** 3)
Step 5: Treasure 47 coins shared among 4 allies (use // and %).

content.starter_code:
# Write your Python code here
print("Hello, World!")
content.expected_output:
Hero HP: 103 
Power Spell: 27 
Each ally gets 11 coins 
Leftover coins: 3
content.solution:
hero_hp = 120 
hero_hp -= (5 + 3) * 4 
hero_hp += 15 
power = 3 ** 3 
coins = 47 
allies = 4 
print("Hero HP:", hero_hp) 
print("Power Spell:", power) 
print("Each ally gets", coins // allies, "coins") 
print("Leftover coins:", coins % allies)
